episodes.summary: Bart trades lives with his multi-millionaire lookalike, but discovers that his lookalike's life isn't all he thought it would be.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XIX
episodes.summary: The Simpsons' 19th Halloween Special, with parodies of "Transformers," "Mad Men," and "It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown."

episodes.title: Dangerous Curves
episodes.summary: The Simpsons take a Fourth of July vacation to a cabin hotel, which cause Homer and Marge to reminisce about two episodes from their past where they stayed in the cabin.

episodes.title: Homer and Lisa Exchange Cross Words
episodes.summary: Homer gets a job breaking up couples, and Lisa becomes an expert crossword puzzle solver, but Homer bets against her in a competition.

episodes.title: MyPods and Boomsticks
episodes.summary: Homer suspects that the family of Bart's new Muslim friend from Jordan is part of a terrorist plot, and Lisa becomes obsessed with her new MyPod.

episodes.title: The Burns and the Bees
episodes.summary: Mr. Burns wins a professional basketball team in a poker game, and the new arena he plans to have Springfield build for the team threatens to interfere with Lisa's new bee sanctuary.

episodes.title: Lisa the Drama Queen
episodes.summary: Lisa and her new best friend create their own fantasy world, but Marge doesn't want Lisa to see her friend anymore after she finds out that they're too far gone in it.

episodes.title: Take My Life, Please
episodes.summary: Homer finds out that he actually won the senior class president election, and he gets an opportunity to find out how his life would have been different if it had happened.

episodes.title: How the Test Was Won
episodes.summary: Bart and his fellow underachievers are taken on a "field trip" to Capital City so that they can miss the standardized test, and Homer makes sure that nothing bad happens until their insurance goes back into effect.

episodes.title: No Loan Again, Naturally
episodes.summary: The Simpsons lose their house, but Flanders buys it and offers to rent it back to them. But when they turn out to be less-than-reliable renters, Flanders kicks them out.

episodes.title: Gone Maggie Gone
episodes.summary: In order to rescue Maggie from a Catholic orphanage, Lisa must solve a series of puzzles to reveal the identity of a gem that will bring peace to Springfield.

episodes.title: In the Name of the Grandfather
episodes.summary: The Simpsons take Grandpa to Ireland so he can go back to visit a pub he went to during the war, but Grandpa and Homer get suckered into buying the bar.

episodes.title: Wedding for Disaster
episodes.summary: Homer is kidnapped moments before he and Marge are supposed to re-renew their vows. However, Marge comes to the conclusion that Homer left her at the altar.

episodes.title: Eeny Teeny Maya Moe
episodes.summary: Moe begins dating a little person he met on the Internet, while Maggie is being bullied at the playground next to Moe's where Homer is leaving her.

episodes.title: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly
episodes.summary: Bart gets Milhouse to take the rap for a prank at school, and then blows him off when he falls for a cute 5th grade do-gooder, prompting Milhouse's wrath. Meanwhile, Lisa begins taking "happy pills" to improve her negative outlook.

episodes.title: Father Knows Worst
episodes.summary: Homer becomes a "helicopter parent" at Springfield Elementary by helping Bart finish a class project and helping Lisa become popular, and Marge finds a secret sauna in their house.

episodes.title: Waverly Hills, 9021-D'Oh
episodes.summary: The Simpsons set up a fake residence in Waverly Hills so that Bart and Lisa can attend school there.

episodes.title: Four Great Women and a Manicure
episodes.summary: A series of parodies based on four strong women: Queen Elizabeth, Snow White, Lady MacBeth, and Ayn Rand.

episodes.title: Coming to Homerica
episodes.summary: Townspeople build a wall around Springfield to keep "immigrants" from Ogdenville from relocating to their town.

episodes.title: Homer the Whopper
episodes.summary: A Hollywood studio makes a movie based on Comic Book Guy's comic book character "Everyman," and Homer is cast in the lead. However, Homer's weight fluctuations cause problems for the production.

episodes.title: Bart Gets a 'Z'
episodes.summary: When Bart's prank gets Ms. Krabappel fired from Springfield Elementary School, he tries to make it up to her without letting her know that he was responsible.

episodes.title: The Great Wife Hope
episodes.summary: Marge takes on the owner of an ultimate fighting league in the ring in order to get the sport banned in Springfield.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XX
episodes.summary: Lisa becomes livid with Miss Hoover, and in a series of homages to classic Hitchcock sets out for deadly revenge. Next, Krusty's latest fast-food sandwich transforms news anchor Kent Brockman into an enraged zombie and twenty-eight days later, cannibal zombies have overrun Springfield. In the final frightening fable, Homer accidentally falls through a trapdoor in Moe's tavern and impales himself on the pipes of Moe's microbrewery. Moe serves the barflies a glass of delicious beer flavored with Homer's blood and Homer, now half-man, half-brewing apparatus, returns for ...

episodes.title: The Devil Wears Nada
episodes.summary: Marge rediscovers her sexuality after appearing in a racy calendar, but Homer is too tired to respond to her advances because he is being worked to death by his new boss, Carl.

episodes.title: Pranks and Greens
episodes.summary: Bart meets the boy responsible for the greatest prank in Springfield Elementary School history, and discovers that he's now a 19-year-old loser. Meanwhile, Marge is scolded for providing unhealthy snacks for Maggie's play group.

episodes.title: Rednecks and Broomsticks
episodes.summary: Homer becomes an expert on moonshine when he starts hanging out with Cletus after he saves the Simpsons' lives, while Lisa becomes friends with three teenage Wiccans.

episodes.title: Oh Brother, Where Bart Thou?
episodes.summary: Bart becomes jealous of Maggie and Lisa's special bond as sisters, so he goes to an orphanage and "adopts" a little brother.

episodes.title: Thursdays with Abie
episodes.summary: Homer becomes jealous when a syndicated newspaper columnist begins publishing Grandpa's stories, while Bart is assigned to take care of the class's stuffed sheep for the weekend.

episodes.title: Once Upon a Time in Springfield
episodes.summary: The antagonism between Krusty and the new female co-star forced upon him soon turns to romance, while a headhunter encourages Homer, Lenny and Carl to take a job at another nuclear power plant.

episodes.title: Million Dollar Maybe
episodes.summary: Homer can't tell Marge he won the lottery because he was supposed to be giving a wedding toast when he bought the ticket. But Bart soon finds out where he's hiding the money and begins to blackmail him.

episodes.title: Boy Meets Curl
episodes.summary: Homer and Marge become members of the U.S. Olympic curling team. At the games, Lisa becomes addicted to collecting pins, and Bart tries to save her.

episodes.title: The Color Yellow
episodes.summary: While searching for an admirable ancestor for a class project, Lisa discovers the story of a relative named Eliza Simpson, who may or may not have helped a slave escape to freedom.

episodes.title: Postcards from the Wedge
episodes.summary: When Bart unsuccessfully tries to play Homer and Marge against each other, he comes up with a dangerous prank that is sure to get their attention.

episodes.title: Stealing First Base
episodes.summary: Bart gets Springfield Elementary School in legal trouble when he kisses the enigmatic daughter of two lawyers, while Lisa is depressed about being ostracized because she is smart.

episodes.title: The Greatest Story Ever D'ohed
episodes.summary: Ned takes the Simpsons on a pilgrimage to Israel in order to try and save Homer, but soon discovers that he may not be worth saving.

episodes.title: American History X-cellent
episodes.summary: Mr Burns is sent to prison for art theft, where a scary inmate introduces him to religion. Meanwhile Smithers becomes the boss at the plant, and Bart and Lisa try to share an ant farm.

episodes.title: Chief of Hearts
episodes.summary: Homer and Chief Wiggum's new friendship is put to the test when the chief becomes needy after being shot, while Marge suspects that Bart may be dealing drugs.

episodes.title: The Squirt and the Whale
episodes.summary: After a violent storm, Lisa tries to rally the townspeople and come to the rescue of a beached whale.

episodes.title: To Surveil, with Love
episodes.summary: Springfield covers the town with surveillance cameras after Homer creates a bomb scare at the train station. Meanwhile, Lisa considers becoming a brunette so that people will take her more seriously.

episodes.title: Moe Letter Blues
episodes.summary: Homer, Apu and Reverend Lovejoy all suspect that Moe may have left with one of their wives after receiving a mysterious letter, but which one is it?

episodes.title: The Bob Next Door
episodes.summary: Bart is convinced that the Simpsons' new friendly, unassuming neighbor is actually Sideshow Bob in disguise.

episodes.title: Judge Me Tender
episodes.summary: Moe's gruff and abrasive personality makes him the perfect hyper-critical judge, and lands him a spot on American Idol. Meanwhile, Homer makes Marge uncomfortable when he starts spending more time at home with Moe's now closed.

episodes.title: Elementary School Musical
episodes.summary: While Homer and Bart accompany Krusty to Oslo so he can receive the Nobel Peace Prize, Marge enrolls Lisa for a week in performing arts camp.

episodes.title: Loan-a Lisa
episodes.summary: Lisa uses the $50 she receives from Grandpa to give Nelson a microloan to jump-start his bicycle business, but soon comes to regret the decision.

episodes.title: MoneyBart
episodes.summary: Lisa takes over as manager of Bart's baseball team and uses statistical analysis to build a winner, but she takes all of the fun out of it and causes Bart to quit the team.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXI
episodes.summary: A Satanic board game causes other popular board games to come to life, Homer and Marge rescue a possible killer and let him on their boat, and a parody of "Twilight" where Lisa falls for a young vampire.

episodes.title: Lisa Simpson, This Isn't Your Life
episodes.summary: When Lisa discovers that Marge was also a model student, she tries to find out where everything changed so that she doesn't repeat her mistakes. Meanwhile, a series of chance accidents cause Bart to replace Nelson as school bully.

episodes.title: The Fool Monty
episodes.summary: After Mr. Burns finds out that he is dying, he has an accident and loses his memory, and all the townspeople use the situation to get their revenge on him.

episodes.title: How Munched Is That Birdie in the Window?
episodes.summary: Bart adopts a carrier pigeon, but Santa's Little Helper eats it.

episodes.title: The Fight Before Christmas
episodes.summary: Marge gets depressed when the rest of the family does not get into the holiday spirit, and she writes a letter, hoping to get some help; Mr. Burns and Moe's new friend delay the Simpsons as they attempt to travel to Hawaii for the holiday.

episodes.title: Donnie Fatso
episodes.summary: Homer goes to prison after attempting to get out of a series of fines with a bribe, but agrees to a reduced sentence by informing on Fat Tony for the FBI.

episodes.title: Moms I'd Like to Forget
episodes.summary: Bart sets out to uncover the origins of a sword-shaped scar on his hand; Marge reconnects with three friends she fell out with years ago.

episodes.title: Flaming Moe
episodes.summary: Moe tries to keep his 'straightness' a secret when he opens a gay bar; Skinner falls for a new teacher.

episodes.title: Homer the Father
episodes.summary: Homer picks up parenting advice from an 80s sitcom; Bart becomes involved in trading nuclear secrets.

episodes.title: The Blue and the Gray
episodes.summary: Moe employs Homer as his wing man, only to find Homer has more luck with the ladies than he does; Marge finds her first gray hair.

episodes.title: Angry Dad: The Movie
episodes.summary: Bart's "Angry Dad" character gets his own movie, but when the movie starts winning awards, Homer tries to hog all the credit.

episodes.title: The Scorpion's Tale
episodes.summary: Lisa's school project leads to the discovery of a new drug that makes the elderly less cranky and more tolerable.

episodes.title: A Midsummer's Nice Dreams
episodes.summary: After Tommy Chong walks away from the Cheech & Chong reunion tour, Homer goes on the road as his replacement. Meanwhile, Marge tries to help the cat lady with her hoarding problem.

episodes.title: Love Is a Many Strangled Thing
episodes.summary: The tables are turned for Homer and Bart after a therapist cures Homer of his violent tendencies toward the boy.

episodes.title: The Great Simpsina
episodes.summary: The family is greeted by folk singer Ewell Freestone when they visit a peach farm, but when Marge goes overboard with peach-inspired dishes, Lisa and Bart try to get rid of the unwanted fruit. Later, Lisa becomes a magician's apprentice to the legendary Great Raymondo who helps her develop her craft, but a schoolgirl crush clouds her judgment when she is coaxed into revealing the Great Raymondo's most famous magic trick to his phony archnemesis. But when the rival magician's act takes a risky turn, the Great Raymondo has one last trick up his sleeve and stages ...

episodes.title: The Real Housewives of Fat Tony
episodes.summary: Selma falls in love with and marries Fat Tony, and Lisa discovers that Bart has a skill for finding truffles.

episodes.title: Homer Scissorhands
episodes.summary: Homer opens his own salon after he discovers that he has skills as a hair stylist, and Lisa becomes suspicious after Millhouse gets a 5th grade girlfriend.

episodes.title: 500 Keys
episodes.summary: While Homer takes the Duff Blimp for a joyride, Lisa discovers a secret room in the basement of Sprinfield Elementary School.

episodes.title: The Ned-Liest Catch
episodes.summary: When Krabbapple gets suspended and put into detention after hurting Bart, Bart tries to break her out, but it ends that Flanders is the one that saves her life. But soon, Ned figures out that Edna has also dated other men such as Homer, Skinner Comic Book Guy and Aerosmith drummer Joey Kramer.

episodes.title: The Falcon and the D'Ohman
episodes.summary: Homer tries to befriend the new security guard at the nuclear power plant, who for some unknown reason isn't interested and keeps having flashbacks to his violent past as a government agent.

episodes.title: Bart Stops to Smell the Roosevelts
episodes.summary: Superintendant Chalmers gets fired after using unconventional methods to teach Bart and his friends about Teddy Roosevelt, so the boys take over Springfield Elementary until he gets his old job back.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXII
episodes.summary: Homer takes a dangerous dive into an isolated canyon on Candy Peak, but when a crashing boulder traps his arm, he channels Aron Ralston to save himself. In "The Diving Bell and Butterball," the first of three hair-raising Halloween tales, a venomous spider bite leaves Homer paralyzed, but when Lisa discovers Homer's ability to communicate through natural gases, he is able to express his love for Marge. The killer spells continue in "Dial D for Diddly," when Ned Flanders, devout preacher by day, transforms into a cold-blooded vigilante by night. In the final terrifying...

episodes.title: Replaceable You
episodes.summary: Homer is betrayed by his new assistant at work and winds up working for her, and Bart and Martin create a science project that brings joy to the seniors at the Springfield Retirement Castle.

episodes.title: The Food Wife
episodes.summary: Homer is worried that he is no longer the cool parent after Marge, Bart, and Lisa become foodies.

episodes.title: The Book Job
episodes.summary: Homer and Bart put together a team to author the next successful tween novel franchise and make a million dollars, but discover that they need Lisa's help to pull it off.

episodes.title: The Man in the Blue Flannel Pants
episodes.summary: Homer gets promoted to accounts manager at the nuclear power plant, but soon learns the job robs you of your soul. Meanwhile, Lisa introduces Bart to "Little Women."

episodes.title: The Ten-Per-Cent Solution
episodes.summary: Krusty the Clown is stuck in a rut when the television network pulls his show from the air and his talent agency drops him as a client. But when the Simpsons introduce him to seasoned agent Annie, they are surprised to learn that Annie was Krusty's very first agent. Despite their rocky relationship, Annie is convinced to re-sign Krusty and craft his career comeback. But when Krusty's retro comedy show reboot is deemed a critical success, Krusty must decide to stay with his agent or side with the network executives.

episodes.title: Holidays of Future Passed
episodes.summary: Thirty years in the future the Simpsons get together for Christmas. Bart and Lisa are struggling as parents to connect with their children.

episodes.title: Politically Inept, with Homer Simpson
episodes.summary: Homer becomes the host of a popular political talk show, starts an "everyman" movement in Springfield, and ends up hand-picking Ted Nugent as the Republican nominee for president.

episodes.title: The D'oh-cial Network
episodes.summary: Lisa creates an online social network that becomes a Springfield obsession, but later becomes a victim of user backlash.

episodes.title: Moe Goes from Rags to Riches
episodes.summary: While Bart tries to regain Milhouse's friendship, Moe's bar cleaning rag tells his unlikely story of how he got to where he is today.

episodes.title: The Daughter Also Rises
episodes.summary: Lisa falls for an adventurous, Hemingway-esque young boy, while Bart and Millhouse set out to bust all the myths that surround Springfield Elementary School.

episodes.title: At Long Last Leave
episodes.summary: The town votes to kick the Simpsons out of Springfield, so they decide to move to the Outlands.

episodes.title: Exit Through the Kwik-E-Mart
episodes.summary: Bart becomes an urban vandal and decides to use Homer as his inspiration, while Apu hits hard times when a new trendy market takes all the Kwik-E-Mart customers.

episodes.title: How I Wet Your Mother
episodes.summary: The family break into Homer's dreams Inception-style after he begins wetting the bed.

episodes.title: Them, Robot
episodes.summary: Mr. Burns replaces all of the nuclear plant employees with robots--except for Homer, who stays along to supervise the robots and serve as a human scapegoat.

episodes.title: Beware My Cheating Bart
episodes.summary: Jimbo's girlfriend cheats on Jimbo with Bart, and Homer uses his new treadmill to catch up on a TV series about plane crash victims stranded on an island.

episodes.title: A Totally Fun Thing Bart Will Never Do Again
episodes.summary: Bart gets the family to take the cruise vacation of his dreams, and then launches a fiendish plot to ensure that it goes on forever.

episodes.title: The Spy Who Learned Me
episodes.summary: Homer uses his paid sick leave to improve his marriage, with the help of his imaginary friend, super-spy Stradivarius Cain. Meanwhile, Bart gets revenge on Nelson for stealing everyone's lunch money.

episodes.title: Ned 'N Edna's Blend Agenda
episodes.summary: After Ned and Edna announce publicly that they were secretly married, the two clash over how to raise Rod and Todd.

episodes.title: Lisa Goes Gaga
episodes.summary: After a desperate attempt by Lisa to become more popular backfires, Lady Gaga shows up in Springfield to help her with her self-esteem.

episodes.title: Moonshine River
episodes.summary: The Simpsons go back to New York City so that Bart can find his old girlfriend Mary Spuckler. Meanwhile, Lisa and Marge spend the trip trying to take in New York culture on the cheap.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXIII
episodes.summary: A black hole threatens to swallow Springfield, Homer tries to find the source of paranormal activity, and a "Back to the Future" parody in which Bart keeps Marge from marrying Homer.

episodes.title: Adventures in Baby-Getting
episodes.summary: Marge decides that she wants another baby, but Homer doesn't want one. Meanwhile, Bart tries to figure out where Lisa is secretly going after school.

episodes.title: Gone Abie Gone
episodes.summary: Homer invests Lisa's college fund on an online poker site. Meanwhile Abe disappears from the Springfield Retirement Castle.

episodes.title: Penny-Wiseguys
episodes.summary: Fat Tony has to serve jury duty, and his clerk, Dan, must run the mafia while he's gone. Meanwhile, Lisa considers making a disgusting change to her diet.

episodes.title: A Tree Grows in Springfield
episodes.summary: Homer becomes addicted to his new tablet computer. But when it is destroyed Homer becomes despondent, until he finds and provides hope for Springfield in the most unlikely place.

episodes.title: The Day the Earth Stood Cool
episodes.summary: Homer befriends a hipster and invites his family to move in next door. However, their friendship soon sours as Springfield is transformed into a haven for "coolness."

episodes.title: To Cur with Love
episodes.summary: When Homer shows no remorse over almost losing Santa's Little Helper, Grandpa tells everyone the story of Homer's childhood dog.

episodes.title: Homer Goes to Prep School
episodes.summary: Homer joins the "Springfield Preppers," an off-the-grid survivalist group whose leader has set up a top-secret retreat outside of town to prepare for the end of the world.

episodes.title: A Test Before Trying
episodes.summary: The fate of Springfield Elementary rests on Bart and his test scores, and Homer finds way to make money with his own parking meter.

episodes.title: Changing of the Guardian
episodes.summary: Homer and Marge find the perfect young couple and ask them to be the guardians for the kids in case something happens to them.

episodes.title: Love Is a Many Splintered Thing
episodes.summary: Mary Spuckler returns to Springfield and begins a relationship with Bart. However, Bart treats her with disrespect.

episodes.title: Hardly Kirk-ing
episodes.summary: Bart poses Millhouse as his father so that they can do adult activities, and Homer becomes skilled at finding lost objects thanks to Highlights magazine.

episodes.title: Gorgeous Grampa
episodes.summary: Homer's obsession with the TV show "Storage Battles" leads the family to discover Grampa's past identity as "Gorgeous Godfrey," the most feared, villainous man in pro-wrestling history

episodes.title: Black-Eyed, Please
episodes.summary: Ned gets fed up with Homer and punches him in the eye, and Lisa is a bullying victim from her new substitute teacher.

episodes.title: Dark Knight Court
episodes.summary: When Bart is accused of a prank he says he didn't commit, Lisa is forced to defend him in youth court, with former attorney general Janet Reno serving as judge.

episodes.title: What Animated Women Want
episodes.summary: Homer contemplates his next move after getting in the doghouse with Marge, while Millhouse's new Stanley Kowalski-inspired persona makes him suddenly attractive to Lisa.

episodes.title: Pulpit Friction
episodes.summary: Springfield gets a bedbug scare, the new assistant pastor at church appoints Homer as a deacon, and Marge loses her wedding dress.

episodes.title: Whiskey Business
episodes.summary: A new makeover could put Moe in a position to make big money, Bart fails at his job of taking care of Grandpa, and Lisa fights the shameless exploitation of Bleeding Gums Murphy's likeness.

episodes.title: The Fabulous Faker Boy
episodes.summary: Bart takes piano lessons from a cute Russian girl, Marge tries to teach the girl's father how to drive, and Homer loses the last of his hair.

episodes.title: The Saga of Carl
episodes.summary: Homer, Moe, Lenny and Carl win the lottery, but Carl steals the ticket and leaves with the money for Iceland.

episodes.title: Dangers on a Train
episodes.summary: When Marge tries to buy Homer snack cakes for their anniversary, she winds up meeting a married man who shares a common love of British television.

episodes.title: Homerland
episodes.summary: Homer returns from a nuclear power convention a changed man, and Lisa begins to suspect that he has become a domestic terrorist.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXIV
episodes.summary: The scariest Simpsons Halloween show yet, featuring an opening by Guillermo Del Toro.

episodes.title: Four Regrettings and a Funeral
episodes.summary: While attending a funeral, Homer, Marge, Mr. Burns, and Kent Brockman recall a past regret and try to find a way to rectify the situation.

episodes.title: YOLO
episodes.summary: Homer is stunned to learn he'll only live once. A pen pal from his youth helps him live that life to its fullest. Meanwhile Springfield Elementary institutes an honor code.

episodes.title: Labor Pains
episodes.summary: Homer helps take care of a child that he delivered in an elevator, and Lisa tries to organize the Springfield Atoms cheerleaders against the team's greedy owner.

episodes.title: The Kid Is All Right
episodes.summary: Lisa is distressed when she discovers that her new friend is a Republican, and they wind up running against each other as Springfield Elementary's second grade representative.

episodes.title: Yellow Subterfuge
episodes.summary: Principal Skinner promises the students that the best-behaved can take a ride in a submarine. Bart believes his past indiscretions will be forgotten. Lisa tries to help Krusty by suggesting him to sell the foreign rights to his shows.

episodes.title: White Christmas Blues
episodes.summary: When a sudden tourist spike means that the family cannot afford Christmas, the Simpsons open up their house to boarders.

episodes.title: Steal This Episode
episodes.summary: Fed up with the high price of Hollywood films, Homer begins screening pirated movies in his backyard, but is busted by the FBI after Marge turns him in.

episodes.title: Married to the Blob
episodes.summary: Comic Book Guy seeks romantic advice from Homer when he falls for a Japanese woman who's interested in manga.

episodes.title: Specs and the City
episodes.summary: Mr. Burns' Christmas present to his employees, a pair of augmented reality glasses, places a strain on Homer and Marge's relationship. Meanwhile, Bart wrestles with giving a Valentine's Day card to Nelson.

episodes.title: Diggs
episodes.summary: Bart becomes friends with a schoolmate who enjoys falconry, but turns out to be mentally disturbed.

episodes.title: The Man Who Grew Too Much
episodes.summary: Lisa becomes friends with Sideshow Bob, who now has a new job working with genetically-altered foods. Meanwhile, Marge becomes frustrated teaching abstinence for the church.

episodes.title: The Winter of His Content
episodes.summary: When Abe and two of his friends move in with the Simpsons after the Springfield Retirement Castle closes, Homer begins to embrace their lifestyle. Meanwhile, Nelson initiates Bart into the bully group after coming to his defense.

episodes.title: The War of Art
episodes.summary: The friendship between the Simpsons and the Van Houtens is challenged when a painting the Simpsons buy from the Van Houtens' yard sale is discovered to be extremely valuable.

episodes.title: You Don't Have to Live Like a Referee
episodes.summary: Homer becomes a referee for the World Cup and finds himself tested by bribers when the Simpsons travel to Brazil.

episodes.title: Luca$
episodes.summary: Marge becomes worried when Lisa starts dating a competitive eater-in-training, while Bart receives gifts from Snake Jailbird for helping him out.

episodes.title: Days of Future Future
episodes.summary: Thirty years into the future, Bart is having trouble dealing with his divorce, Lisa is struggling with her marriage to Milhouse, and Marge is finally fed up after burying yet another Homer clone.

episodes.title: What to Expect When Bart's Expecting
episodes.summary: Bart becomes a savior to Springfield couples trying to conceive when he inadvertently uses voodoo to get his art teacher pregnant.

episodes.title: Brick Like Me
episodes.summary: The Lego version of Homer begins to suspect that his entire Lego world is not real when a toy triggers a flashback to an alternate reality.

episodes.title: Pay Pal
episodes.summary: When Homer ruins his and Marge's chances of making a new couple friend, Marge decides to concentrate on finding a friend for Lisa. However, Lisa suddenly makes a new friend on her own.

episodes.title: The Yellow Badge of Cowardge
episodes.summary: Bart wins the annual "last day of school" race - with a little help from Nelson - and Homer attempts to bring back 4th of July fireworks, which have been canceled due to low budget cuts.

episodes.title: Clown in the Dumps
episodes.summary: Krusty has a crisis of conscience and retires from show business after his father dies before ever approving of his career. Meanwhile, Lisa becomes worried about Homer's health and life expectancy.

episodes.title: The Wreck of the Relationship
episodes.summary: Homer and Bart turn to the open seas to improve their relationship, and Marge becomes a trash talking victim after she drafts Homer's fantasy football team.

episodes.title: Super Franchise Me
episodes.summary: Marge opens a sandwich franchise store after her sandwiches become a huge hit at Springfield Elementary. But running day-to-day at the store proves challenging, especially when the same franchise opens another location across the street.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXV
episodes.summary: The 25th annual 'Simpsons' Halloween special includes an alternate dimension, a "Clockwork Orange"-style gang led by Moe and a visit from the Tracey Ullman-era Simpsons.

episodes.title: Opposites A-Frack
episodes.summary: An Assemblywoman brought in by Lisa to stop Mr. Burns' fracking operation ends up falling for him as much as he does for her.

episodes.title: Simpsorama
episodes.summary: The Simpsons meet the Planet Express crew, who have come to Springfield in the present to stop them from destroying the future.

episodes.title: Blazed and Confused
episodes.summary: Bart tricks his family into a camping trip at a strange event known as "Blazing Guy" so that he can get revenge on his sadistic new fourth grade teacher.

episodes.title: Covercraft
episodes.summary: Homer forms a cover band with other dads in town when he takes up bass guitar to deal with a mid-life crisis, but the band's modest success is soon overwhelmed by Apu's breakout potential.

episodes.title: I Won't Be Home for Christmas
episodes.summary: Marge kicks Homer out of the house for Christmas after he consoles Moe on Christmas Eve instead of going home.

episodes.title: The Man Who Came to Be Dinner
episodes.summary: An amusement park ride takes the Simpsons to the home planet of Kang and Kodos.

episodes.title: Bart's New Friend
episodes.summary: Homer is hypnotized into believing he's ten years old and ends up stuck in his new age when the hypnotist dies, so he bonds with Bart and refuses to take back the responsibilities of adulthood.

episodes.title: The Musk Who Fell to Earth
episodes.summary: Inventor Elon Musk comes to Springfield, and Homer inspires him with a new idea that could revolutionize Springfield, but winds up costing Mr. Burns a ton of money.

episodes.title: Walking Big & Tall
episodes.summary: Marge tries to get Homer to lose weight. But instead, he finds a support group that encourages him to embrace his largeness.

episodes.title: My Fare Lady
episodes.summary: Marge gets a job as a driver for a transportation app service, while Moe is forced to work as a janitor at the nuclear plant after Homer causes the bar to go bankrupt.

episodes.title: The Princess Guide
episodes.summary: Moe falls in love with a Nigerian princess whose father is working out a uranium deal with Mr. Burns.

episodes.title: Sky Police
episodes.summary: The congregation, led by Marge, is forced to resort to gambling in order to collect money to fix the church, which Chief Wiggum destroyed with a jet pack he received by mistake.

episodes.title: Waiting for Duffman
episodes.summary: After "Duffman" retires, Homer wins a reality competition to become his replacement. But his contract states that he cannot drink beer, which gives him a new perspective on alcohol.

episodes.title: Peeping Mom
episodes.summary: Marge decides to follow Bart everywhere until he confesses to being involved in a bulldozer crash. Meanwhile, Homer ignores Santa's Little Helper when Ned gets a new dog.

episodes.title: The Kids Are All Fight
episodes.summary: The story of Bart and Lisa's rivalry is told when Homer finds an old film strip.

episodes.title: Let's Go Fly a Coot
episodes.summary: Bart takes up smoking e-cigarettes to impress Milhouse's cousin Annika while the rest of the family learns about Grampa's days in the Air Force.

episodes.title: Bull-E
episodes.summary: Bart gets bullied at a school dance, so Marge gets an anti-bullying law passed, which results in Homer being put in therapy for bulling Ned.

episodes.title: Mathlete's Feat
episodes.summary: Groundskeeper Willie becomes the coach of the mathletes, Lisa and other kids from Springfield Elementary compete against Waverly Hills Elementary.

episodes.title: Every Man's Dream
episodes.summary: Marge decides it's finally time to separate from Homer, and quickly moves on with her life. Homer is initially devastated, but soon stumbles into a romance with a younger woman.

episodes.title: 'Cue Detective
episodes.summary: A celebrity television chef challenges Homer to a barbecue cook-off. But before the competition, Homer's new, prized barbecue grill is stolen.

episodes.title: Puffless
episodes.summary: Patty and Selma try to quit smoking, but Patty moves in with the Simpsons when Selma takes it up again. Meanwhile, Maggie goes on an adventure with some local creatures.

episodes.title: Halloween of Horror
episodes.summary: The Simpsons are proud to be the most festively decorated house on the block. But when Lisa is traumatized at Krustyland Horror Night, she feels she cannot handle Halloween anymore.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXVI
episodes.summary: After killing Bart, Sideshow Bob doesn't know what to do with himself; Homer wakes up with short-term memory loss; Because of radiation, Lisa, Bart and Milhouse gain super-powers.

episodes.title: Friend with Benefit
episodes.summary: Lisa makes a new friend at school - Harper, who happens to be super-rich, while Homer makes friends with Harper's dad and sets out to continue living the good life when Lisa decides to end the friendship.

episodes.title: Lisa with an "S"
episodes.summary: Broadway legend Laney Fontaine transforms Lisa into a show-biz kid after Homer loses her chance at band camp.

episodes.title: Paths of Glory
episodes.summary: Lisa tries to restore the reputation of a forgotten Springfield female inventor, while Bart takes full advantage of a diagnosis that he is a sociopath.

episodes.title: Barthood
episodes.summary: A tale of Bart's journey from youth to adulthood, where he is constantly in search of approval from his father and in the shadow of his more-successful younger sister.

episodes.title: The Girl Code
episodes.summary: When Homer loses his job due to Marge's social media post, he begins working as a dishwasher at a Greek restaurant. Meanwhile, Lisa creates an app that can predict the effect any post on social media will have.

episodes.title: Teenage Mutant Milk-Caused Hurdles
episodes.summary: Bart and Principal Skinner battle over the affection of Bart's new teacher, and a new milk-based product that Homer buys from the Kwik-E-Mart causes big changes in Bart and Lisa.

episodes.title: Much Apu About Something
episodes.summary: Apu's nephew makes big changes when he takes over the Kwik-E-Mart business, and Bart decides that he's through with being bad after his latest prank spirals out of control.

episodes.title: Love Is in the N2-O2-Ar-CO2-Ne-He-CH4
episodes.summary: Professor Frink's new invention turns him into a ladies' man, while a new pill at the Springfield Retirement Castle causes Grandpa to hallucinate back to his happiest moments.

episodes.title: Gal of Constant Sorrow
episodes.summary: Lisa tries to launch the career of a homeless Appalachian folk singer, but Bart warns her that she will just let her down. Meanwhile, Homer tries to rescue the cat, who is trapped in the walls of the house.

episodes.title: Lisa the Veterinarian
episodes.summary: Lisa takes a job as veterinarian's assistant, but soon lets the responsibilities of the job get to her head. Meanwhile, Marge decides to take a job as a crime scene cleaner.

episodes.title: The Marge-ian Chronicles
episodes.summary: Lisa signs up for an opportunity to be part of a mission to colonize Mars in ten years, and Homer's strategy to use reverse psychology to talk her out of it backfires.

episodes.title: The Burns Cage
episodes.summary: Homer tries to raise Smithers' spirits by finding him a man, and Lisa gets the lead in the school production of "Casablanca" alongside a new male student, sparking Millhouse's jealousy.

episodes.title: How Lisa Got Her Marge Back
episodes.summary: After Lisa overhears Marge say that she doesn't like Lisa's jazz music, Marge takes Lisa on a trip to Capitol City to regain her friendship. Meanwhile, Bart uses Maggie as his new partner in crime for his practical jokes.

episodes.title: Fland Canyon
episodes.summary: Maggie will not go to sleep, so Homer tells her a bedtime story about when the Simpsons and the Flanders went to the Grand Canyon together.

episodes.title: To Courier with Love
episodes.summary: After promising Marge the trip of a lifetime, Homer makes a deal with a travel agent to be a courier of a top-secret briefcase in exchange for a discounted family vacation to Paris.

episodes.title: Simprovised
episodes.summary: While trying to overcome a fear of public speaking, Homer creates an improv comedy troupe; Marge rebuilds Bart's treehouse.

episodes.title: Orange Is the New Yellow
episodes.summary: Marge lets Bart go to the park alone because he's too irritating, then she ends up getting arrested for leaving him unsupervised.

episodes.title: Monty Burns' Fleeing Circus
episodes.summary: Mr. Burns puts on a variety show at the Springfield Bowl.

episodes.title: Friends and Family
episodes.summary: Homer finds a new friend in a woman who acts just like him when Mr. Burns hires the other Simpsons as his live-in virtual reality family.

episodes.title: The Town
episodes.summary: Homer takes the family on a "hate-cation" to Boston after he catches Bart rooting for a rival football team.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXVII
episodes.summary: The children of Springfield fight to the death, Hunger Games style; Lisa's imaginary friend kills her real friends; Moe recruits Bart into his group of covert barfly agents.

episodes.title: Trust But Clarify
episodes.summary: Bart and Lisa investigate Krusty's new candy; Marge helps Homer dress for a promotion; Kent Brockman struggles with the changing media world.

episodes.title: There Will Be Buds
episodes.summary: Homer coaches the kids' lacrosse team with Kirk Van Houten, who disappears before the championship game, after Homer rants about him being a loser.

episodes.title: Havana Wild Weekend
episodes.summary: The Simpsons go to Cuba to get Grampa cheap medical care when the Retirement Castle and V.A. hospital are unable to solve his health problems.

episodes.title: Dad Behavior
episodes.summary: Homer discovers an app that makes his life easier, while Grampa learns that he'll be a father again.

episodes.title: The Last Traction Hero
episodes.summary: Homer is placed in a cast following a workplace accident, leading Marge to receive romance from an unexpected source; Lisa attempts to keep the peace as bus monitor.

episodes.title: The Nightmare After Krustmas
episodes.summary: Krusty and his daughter spend Christmas with the Simpsons; Reverend Lovejoy seeks converts to boost attendance at church; A Christmas toy scares Maggie.

episodes.title: Pork and Burns
episodes.summary: A Japanese book on minimalism inspires Marge to adapt to a new way of living, so the Simpsons have to part with items that no longer bring them joy.

episodes.title: The Great Phatsby
episodes.summary: Mr Burns tries to relive his glory days, and crosses paths with a mysterious music mogul.

episodes.title: Fatzcarraldo
episodes.summary: When all the fast food restaurants in Springfield become healthy, Homer turns to the last bastion of greasy food for comfort; Lisa must find a good news story when her school radio station is in jeopardy.

episodes.title: The Cad and the Hat
episodes.summary: Bart ruins Lisa's perfect day out of jealousy and becomes haunted by the manifestation of his guilty conscious. Homer is revealed to be a master chess player which helps him bond with his competitive dad.

episodes.title: Kamp Krustier
episodes.summary: Bart and Lisa return home following a traumatic incident at Kamp Krusty, putting an end to Homer and Marge's sexual encounters.

episodes.title: 22 for 30
episodes.summary: A mocumentary about how Bart became a star basketball player at Springfield Elementary only to fall prey to fame, his own ego and the schemes of mobster Fat Tony.

episodes.title: A Father's Watch
episodes.summary: As Homer and Marge try a different parenting style on the hellraising Bart, Grampa gives him a special watch that becomes Bart's moral center. But Bart loses it and tries everything to get it back.

episodes.title: The Caper Chase
episodes.summary: Mr. Burns opens his own for-profit university, hiring the completely unqualified Homer as a professor, only to lose him to a mad scientist.

episodes.title: Looking for Mr. Goodbart
episodes.summary: Bart bonds with Skinner's mother over their mutual dislike of Skinner and realizes that he could make a bundle by befriending other lonely and disgruntled grandmothers of Springfield for money.

episodes.title: Moho House
episodes.summary: Mr. Burns makes a bet with his old friend that nothing can break Homer and Marge apart. But that's where Moe comes in.

episodes.title: Dogtown
episodes.summary: After a successful animal rights campaign, all dogs in Springfield are allowed to go where they want and do what they want. Pack mentality quickly kicks in and the dogs of Springfield assert their dominance by threatening the people.

episodes.title: The Serfsons
episodes.summary: In a medieval world, Lisa is forced to use illegal magic when Marge's mother is turned into an Ice Walker.

episodes.title: Springfield Splendor
episodes.summary: Lisa's sad experience is adapted into a graphic novel, which becomes a Broadway show.

episodes.title: Whistler's Father
episodes.summary: Homer launches Maggie's baby-celebrity career with her whistling talent; Marge is hired to style Fat Tony's brothel.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXVIII
episodes.summary: Maggie gets possessed by a demon; Lisa discovers a creepy/perfect version of her family in an alternative universe; Homer cannibalizes himself.

episodes.title: Grampy Can Ya Hear Me
episodes.summary: Grampa gets a hearing aid and finally hears what everyone has been saying about him.

episodes.title: The Old Blue Mayor She Ain't What She Used To Be
episodes.summary: Marge runs for mayor and uses Homer as the butt of her jokes to gain public support.

episodes.title: Singin' in the Lane
episodes.summary: Homer gets his old bowling team back together and they wind up competing with arrogant millionaires.

episodes.title: Mr. Lisa's Opus
episodes.summary: In the future, Lisa writes a college application essay to Harvard and recalls disappointing past birthdays that helped shape her.

episodes.title: Gone Boy
episodes.summary: When Bart goes missing, the town puts together a search party to find him.

episodes.title: Haw-Haw Land
episodes.summary: Lisa falls for a crooning jazz pianist named Brendan; Bart discovers he has an affinity for chemistry.

episodes.title: Frink Gets Testy
episodes.summary: Mr. Burns builds a doomsday ark after he believes the world is ending; Professor Frink is tasked with determining who is worth saving.

episodes.title: Homer is Where the Art Isn't
episodes.summary: Homer is accused of stealing a multimillion-dollar painting and only freelance insurance investigator Manacek can prove his innocence or guilt.

episodes.title: 3 Scenes Plus a Tag from a Marriage
episodes.summary: Homer and Marge tell the story of how they went from loving life without kids to being miserable parents.

episodes.title: Fears of a Clown
episodes.summary: Bart goes to prankster rehab after a clown-mask prank terrifies the town and ruins Krusty's career causing him to give up comedy and try serious drama.

episodes.title: No Good Read Goes Unpunished
episodes.summary: Marge forces everyone to give up their electronics and go to the book store in an effort to bring the family together.

episodes.title: King Leer
episodes.summary: Homer and Marge attempt to reunite Moe with his troubled family.

episodes.title: Lisa Gets the Blues
episodes.summary: The Simpsons' flight to Gainesville gets re-routed to New Orleans, where Lisa must regain her confidence as a jazz musician.

episodes.title: Forgive and Regret
episodes.summary: On his deathbed, Grampa makes a confession to Homer about the notes from Homer's mother that got lost when she left. This angers Homer to the point of refusing to reconcile with Abe after he miraculously recovers.

episodes.title: Left Behind
episodes.summary: Homer gets Flanders a job at the power plant; Marge feels there's no spark left in their marriage.

episodes.title: Throw Grampa from the Dane
episodes.summary: The Simpsons go to Denmark so Grampa can benefit from its free health-care system.

episodes.title: Flanders' Ladder
episodes.summary: When Bart falls into a coma after he is struck by lightning, he is visited by ghosts seeking closure.

episodes.title: Bart's Not Dead
episodes.summary: Bart ends up in the hospital after taking a dare and lies about going to heaven to cover it up, but Homer takes a deal with Christian producers to make a movie about it.

episodes.title: Heartbreak Hotel
episodes.summary: Marge and Homer travel to a tropical island and go on Marge's favorite reality competition program to win a million dollars.

episodes.title: My Way or the Highway to Heaven
episodes.summary: While God and St. Peter discuss who will get into heaven, the citizens of Springfield recall divine encounters.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXIX
episodes.summary: Homer wins an oyster-eating contest against the mythical Cthulhu, Springfield is overrun by plant body-snatchers, Lisa finally snaps and Mr. Burns opens a retirement home with some Jurassic upgrades.

episodes.title: Baby You Can't Drive My Car
episodes.summary: A self-driving car company comes to Springfield, poaching all of the power plant employees with their fun work environment.

episodes.title: From Russia Without Love
episodes.summary: Bart, Nelson and Milhouse get a mail-order bride for Moe as a hardcore prank.

episodes.title: Werking Mom
episodes.summary: In search of a job, Marge gets one selling plastic food storage containers - as a drag queen; Lisa tries to make the world better.

episodes.title: Krusty the Clown
episodes.summary: Krusty hides out at a circus after he nearly kills Homer, who becomes a TV recapper and gives him a bad grade.

episodes.title: Daddicus Finch
episodes.summary: Bart feels neglected when Homer and Lisa bond over To Kill a Mockingbird and start spending quality time together, so Marge attempts to help Homer balance attention between the kids.

episodes.title: 'Tis the 30th Season
episodes.summary: Marge is determined to fix Christmas following a failed Black Friday shopping spree, but Homer and the kids surprise her with a vacation in Florida.

episodes.title: Mad About the Toy
episodes.summary: Motivated by a PTSD episode Grampa had while babysitting the kids, the Simpsons take a journey to Grampa's past as a post-WW2 toy model for plastic army men, and Abe finally faces his on confused sexuality.

episodes.title: The Girl on the Bus
episodes.summary: Lisa tries to live a double life when she makes a new friend and gets a taste of what it would be like to live with a more cultured family.

episodes.title: I'm Dancing as Fat as I Can
episodes.summary: Homer tries to make amends for binging his and Marge's favorite show without her; Bart prepares for "Krusty's Holiday Trample".

episodes.title: The Clown Stays in the Picture
episodes.summary: On Marc Maron's podcast, Krusty reveals the untold story of his past movie project, The Sands of Space. Hearing the podcast, Bart and Lisa learn their parents were production assistants on the movie in the early days of their relationship.

episodes.title: 101 Mitigations
episodes.summary: Homer steals Comic Book Guy's car and must either prove his innocence in court or reconcile with him.

episodes.title: I Want You (She's So Heavy)
episodes.summary: When a romantic night ends in injury for Homer and Marge, Lisa turns to an unlikely source to fix their strained relationship.

episodes.title: E My Sports
episodes.summary: Homer discovers a passion for coaching Bart in video game competitions; Lisa's plan to bring Homer back to reality creates chaos.

episodes.title: Bart vs. Itchy & Scratchy
episodes.summary: Bart's friends start a boys rights activist group to protest Krusty's all-female reboot of Itchy and Scratchy. When they catch Bart enjoying it, they kick him out, so he joins Bossy Riot, a militant feminist gang of sixth-grade girls.

episodes.title: Girl's in the Band
episodes.summary: Homer works extra shifts at the plant so Lisa can play in the Capitol City Youth Philharmonic.

episodes.title: I'm Just a Girl Who Can't Say D'oh
episodes.summary: Marge becomes Director of Springfield's local theater, armed with Lisa's script resembling "Hamilton"; Homer joins a baby class with Maggie, and takes a liking to supervisor Chloe.

episodes.title: D'oh Canada
episodes.summary: Lisa is mistakenly given political asylum in Canada during a family trip to Niagara Falls.

episodes.title: Woo-Hoo Dunnit?
episodes.summary: The documentary crime series "Dateline: Springfield" goes in-depth to solve the case of Lisa's missing college fund.

episodes.title: Crystal Blue-Haired Persuasion
episodes.summary: Marge starts a business selling healing crystals and other New Age products to the naive mothers of Springfield when Homer's job cuts children's health-care benefits, leading Marge to use the crystals as a cheaper solution for Bart's ADD.

episodes.title: The Winter of Our Monetized Content
episodes.summary: Bart and Homer become social media celebrities when a video of them fighting goes viral; Lisa fights the school's new industrialized detention system.

episodes.title: Go Big or Go Homer
episodes.summary: Homer inspires a 35-year-old millennial who idolizes him to start his own business, which leads the mob to chase both of them.

episodes.title: The Fat Blue Line
episodes.summary: When the wrong man is arrested for pickpocketing Springfield during the San Castellaneta street festival, Chief Wiggum sets out to catch the real criminal.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXX
episodes.summary: The 30th Treehouse of Horror features a demon Maggie, a mission to rescue Milhouse from another dimension, dead-Homer's spirit trying on some new bodies for size and Selma finally finding love in an unlikely place - the alien in the basement.

episodes.title: Gorillas on the Mast
episodes.summary: After visiting Aquatraz Water Park, Lisa and Bart set out to free from captivity the most vicious animals in Springfield. Homer fulfills a lifelong dream and buys a boat, only to realize how much boat ownership sucks.

episodes.title: Marge the Lumberjill
episodes.summary: Marge becomes a competitive lumberjack and goes on a month-long retreat to Portland with her trainer, whom Homer fears will take his wife away from him.

episodes.title: Livin la Pura Vida
episodes.summary: The Simpsons join other Springfield families on the Van Houtens' annual trip to Costa Rica, where Homer befriends Patty's new girlfriend and Lisa discovers how the Van Houtens are able to afford this trip every year.

episodes.title: Thanksgiving of Horror
episodes.summary: The Simpsons face various Thanksgiving nightmares, including the first Thanksgiving, an A.I. mishap and a dangerous space mission complicated by a sentient cranberry sauce.

episodes.title: Todd, Todd, Why Hast Thou Forsaken Me?
episodes.summary: Todd blames God for his mother's death and rejects his faith, so Ned sends him to live with the Simpsons, hoping they can scare him into believing in God again.

episodes.title: Bobby, It's Cold Outside
episodes.summary: Sideshow Bob gets the role of Santa Claus at Santa's Village amusement park. Meanwhile, someone is stealing all the Christmas packages off people's front porches.

episodes.title: Hail to the Teeth
episodes.summary: Homer and Marge attend Artie Ziff's wedding and become quite uncomfortable when they realize that his bride-to-be is a clone of Marge.

episodes.title: The Miseducation of Lisa Simpson
episodes.summary: The sea captain finds treasure for which he's been searching for 40 years, but City Hall claims it since it was in city limits. Marge convinces the townspeople to use the windfall to build a STEM school. Homer crusades against automation.

episodes.title: Frinkcoin
episodes.summary: Professor Frink invents a cryptocurrency that makes him the richest man in Springfield, a title Mr. Burns has no intention of giving up.

episodes.title: Bart the Bad Guy
episodes.summary: Bart uses spoilers for a superhero movie he saw to get what he wants, but two movie executives will stop at nothing to keep his knowledge secret.

episodes.title: Screenless
episodes.summary: Marge implements a limit on screen time for the whole family, only to realize she's the one addicted to screens.

episodes.title: Better Off Ned
episodes.summary: Jealous of Bart's bond with Ned, Homer mentors Nelson in retaliation, but an act of heroism helps Homer to regain Bart's respect.

episodes.title: Highway to Well
episodes.summary: Marge gets a job at an upscale cannabis dispensary leading Homer to open a competing business that replicates the scuzzy days of scoring weed from and old-school pot connection.

episodes.title: The Incredible Lightness of Being a Baby
episodes.summary: Maggie reunites with baby Hudson, but Marge isn't too crazy about his mom. Homer befriends Cletus Spuckler who recently discovered a vast underground reserve of helium gas on his property, attracting unwanted attention from Mr. Burns.

episodes.title: Warrin' Priests
episodes.summary: Reverend Lovejoy investigates the mysterious past of a new priest who's come to town and shaken things up at church.

episodes.title: Warrin' Priests Part 2
episodes.summary: In Michigan, Reverend Lovejoy learns the true reason why Bode came to Springfield and the congregation must decide whether to banish their new priest.

episodes.title: The Hateful Eight-Year-Olds
episodes.summary: Lisa joins a group of rich girls when she makes a friend who loves horses; Homer takes Marge on a romantic cruise.

episodes.title: The Way of the Dog
episodes.summary: The Simpsons explore the tragic past of Santa's Little Helper when he bites Marge.

episodes.title: Undercover Burns
episodes.summary: Mr. Burns goes undercover at the power plant as an employee named Fred and befriends Homer and the gang, but a jealous Smithers plots to bring the old Burns back.

episodes.title: I, Carumbus
episodes.summary: At a museum exhibit of Ancient Rome, Marge and Homer imagine themselves in Rome where Homer is more ambitious.

episodes.title: Now Museum, Now You Don't
episodes.summary: Lisa stays home from school and fantasizes about the history of Western art.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXXI
episodes.summary: The 31st annual Simpsons Halloween special includes a frightening look at the 2020 election, parodies of Pixar and Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse and a ninth birthday Lisa just can't get over.

episodes.title: The 7 Beer Itch
episodes.summary: Homer is tempted by a British femme fatale while Marge and the kids are on a seaside vacation.

episodes.title: Podcast News
episodes.summary: Grampa is accused of a crime, while Kent Brockman questions his career.

episodes.title: Three Dreams Denied
episodes.summary: Bart becomes a voice over actor, Comic Book Guy is humiliated at Comic-Con and Lisa is set up for a fall.

episodes.title: The Road to Cincinnati
episodes.summary: Skinner and Chalmers take an 800-mile car ride to an administrator's convention in Cincinnati.

episodes.title: Sorry Not Sorry
episodes.summary: Lisa calls Ms. Hoover a hack and refuses to apologize, then learns her private pain.

episodes.title: A Springfield Summer Christmas for Christmas
episodes.summary: A cable channel films a Christmas movie in Springfield and Skinner falls in love.

episodes.title: The Dad-Feelings Limited
episodes.summary: The origin story of Comic Book Guy is revealed as he and Kumiko debate having a baby.

episodes.title: Diary Queen
episodes.summary: Bart learns a surprising secret when he finds Mrs. Krabappel's diary at a yard sale, while Lisa discovers an even bigger surprise.

episodes.title: Wad Goals
episodes.summary: Bart becomes a successful caddy, but Marge thinks it may ruin his character.

episodes.title: Yokel Hero
episodes.summary: Cletus becomes a singing sensation and ruins everything when he turns on his fans, while Homer becomes a new man.

episodes.title: Do Pizza Bots Dream of Electric Guitars
episodes.summary: Homer tries to reunite a mechanical band from his youth, but J.J. Abrams beats him to it.

episodes.title: Manger Things
episodes.summary: A secret from Flanders' past and a never-before-seen room in the Simpson home are revealed.

episodes.title: Uncut Femmes
episodes.summary: Sarah Wiggum is more than she seems; Marge participates in a jewel heist.

episodes.title: Burger Kings
episodes.summary: Mr. Burns joins the plant-based burger business, convincing Lisa that he's changed for the better.

episodes.title: Panic on the Streets of Springfield
episodes.summary: Lisa's imaginary friend is a depressed British singer from the 1980s; Homer becomes a truck guy.

episodes.title: Mother and Child Reunion
episodes.summary: In the future, Lisa makes a shocking college decision that hurts Marge, leading to a surprising place.

episodes.title: The Man from G.R.A.M.P.A.
episodes.summary: A British secret agent comes to Springfield to find a Russian spy.

episodes.title: The Last Barfighter
episodes.summary: A secret society of bartenders seeks revenge on Homer and his friends when Moe breaks their most sacred rule.

episodes.title: The Star of the Backstage
episodes.summary: Marge stages a revival of a musical from high school, but her pleasant memories are threatened by the return of her old rival.

episodes.title: Bart's in Jail!
episodes.summary: When Grandpa falls victim to a phone scam, the Simpsons set out to get his money back.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXXII
episodes.summary: The 32nd annual Simpsons Halloween special includes a spoof of "Parasite" and a segment where Bambi gets his revenge.

episodes.title: The Wayz We Were
episodes.summary: Moe is faced with a difficult choice when Evergreen Terrace develops a traffic problem.

episodes.title: Lisa's Belly
episodes.summary: Lisa reacts to a hurtful word spoken by Marge while Bart gets swole.

episodes.title: A Serious Flanders
episodes.summary: Homer and Ned get sucked into the violent world of prestige TV when a ruthless debt collector comes to Springfield.

episodes.title: A Serious Flanders: Part 2
episodes.summary: Things go from bad to worse for Homer and Ned.

episodes.title: Portrait of a Lackey on Fire
episodes.summary: Smithers finds true love with a famous fashion designer, but this new relationship may destroy Springfield.

episodes.title: Mothers and Other Strangers
episodes.summary: In a flashback to his teen years, Homer goes on a road trip with his father to search for his mother.

episodes.title: A Made Maggie
episodes.summary: Fat Tony becomes Maggie's godfather.

episodes.title: The Longest Marge
episodes.summary: Marge battles Mr. Burns for the soul of a brash young football prodigy.

episodes.title: Pixelated and Afraid
episodes.summary: Homer and Marge must push themselves to their limits when they get lost in an icy wilderness.

episodes.title: Boyz N the Highlands
episodes.summary: Bart, Martin and the bullies run for their lives when a weekend in the wilderness takes a dark turn.

episodes.title: You Won't Believe What This Episode Is About - Act Three Will Shock You!
episodes.summary: Homer becomes a pariah when footage of him allegedly leaving Santa's Little Helper in a hot car goes viral.

episodes.title: Bart the Cool Kid
episodes.summary: Homer leads a rebellion of loser dads against the friendship between Bart and a famous kid influencer.

episodes.title: Pretty Whittle Liar
episodes.summary: Cletus feels betrayed when he learns that Brandine can read.

episodes.title: The Sound of Bleeding Gums
episodes.summary: Lisa meets the son of the late Bleeding Gums Murphy and tries to improve his life.

episodes.title: My Octopus and a Teacher
episodes.summary: Bart has romantic feelings for his new teacher; Lisa befriends an octopus.

episodes.title: Girls Just Shauna Have Fun
episodes.summary: Lisa finds an unlikely mentor in Shauna Chalmers when she joins the high school marching band; Homer becomes a craft beer brewer.

episodes.title: Marge the Meanie
episodes.summary: Marge bonds with Bart when she discovers a secret from her past, terrifying Homer.

episodes.title: Meat Is Murder
episodes.summary: Grampa reconnects with an old associate in the hamburger business.

episodes.title: Poorhouse Rock
episodes.summary: Bart finally learns to admire Homer, but a visit from a magical singing janitor changes everything they thought they knew.

episodes.title: Habeas Tortoise
episodes.summary: After humiliating himself at a town meeting, Homer looks for acceptance in an internet group on the hunt for a missing tortoise and finds something much more sinister.

episodes.title: One Angry Lisa
episodes.summary: Lisa gets called for jury duty, while Marge becomes obsessed with her exercise bike.

episodes.title: Lisa the Boy Scout
episodes.summary: The show is hijacked by cyber terrorists.

episodes.title: The King of Nice
episodes.summary: Marge gets a job as a segment producer on Krusty's new talk show, which she soon realizes is a never-ending nightmare.

episodes.title: Not It
episodes.summary: Young Homer and his friends are terrorized by a killer clown in a special Treehouse of Horror presentation spoofing Stephen King's "It".

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXXIII
episodes.summary: In the 33rd annual Halloween special, Marge's resentment takes a monstrous form, Lisa tries to save the planet through murder, and Homer realizes that he's not the man he thought he was.

episodes.title: From Beer to Paternity
episodes.summary: Homer and Duffman go on a road trip with Lisa that threatens to expose Homer's bad parenting after he becomes Duffman's girl-dad hero.

episodes.title: Step Brother from the Same Planet
episodes.summary: Homer is filled with rage and resentment when Grampa becomes a stepfather to his girlfriend's son; Lisa and Bart throw the ultimate slumber party.

episodes.title: When Nelson Met Lisa
episodes.summary: Lisa and Nelson become an unlikely couple in the future.

episodes.title: Game Done Changed
episodes.summary: Bart ropes Principal Skinner into his scheme to make off a glitch in an online game; Marge and Maggie discover paradise.

episodes.title: Top Goon
episodes.summary: Moe coaches Bart's hockey team and recruits the world's greatest brawlers to teach Nelson the art of hockey goonery.

episodes.title: My Life as a Vlog
episodes.summary: The rise and fall of the Simpson Family Vlog is told through a series of recommended YouTube videos.

episodes.title: The Many Saints of Springfield
episodes.summary: Ned goes into business with the Springfield mafia.

episodes.title: Carl Carlson Rides Again
episodes.summary: Carl discovers the origins of a mysterious rodeo buckle tied to his identity when he's smitten with a beautiful black woman.

episodes.title: Bartless
episodes.summary: Homer and Marge imagine a world where Bart isn't a Simpson after his latest prank causes chaos at Springfield Elementary.

episodes.title: Hostile Kirk Place
episodes.summary: Kirk goes on a crusade to censor and control the school curriculum in response to a history lesson that paints one of his ancestors in a bad light and Homer comes along for fun and profit.

episodes.title: Pin Gal
episodes.summary: Jacques returns to coach Marge for a bowling tournament.
